Certainly. Fuel efficiency is an important consideration when choosing a transmission, and there are studies that have compared the fuel economy of manual and automatic transmissions. Here are a few data points:

According to a study conducted by the National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL), manual transmissions can provide a fuel economy improvement of up to 15 percent compared to automatic transmissions. This is because manual transmissions allow the driver to control the shift points and engine speed, which can result in better fuel efficiency.

Another study conducted by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) found that automatic transmissions can provide better fuel economy in certain situations. However, the study also found that manual transmissions tend to perform better in city driving conditions, while automatic transmissions tend to perform better in highway driving conditions.

Ultimately, the fuel efficiency of a vehicle depends on many factors, including the engine, weight of the vehicle, driving conditions, and the driver's habits. While manual transmissions can offer significant improvements in fuel economy, the actual percentage difference will vary depending on the specific vehicle and the driving conditions.
